alert.note: Alert for Santa Clarita Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued November 02 at 9:25PM PDT until November 04 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THURSDAY TO 3 AM PDT FRIDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, North winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 32 possible. * WHERE...Santa Clarita Valley. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, from 11 AM Thursday to 3 AM PDT Friday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Thursday night through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.
